poem:
"Of Small Tortoiseshell's Plight"

In a world turned unwelcome, the flutter falls,
In England, little wings fold, mark discords of time.
Small tortoiseshell carries the weight of the world,
Each wingbeat counted, an echo of its decline.
82% of whispers gone since '76, a puzzle in the wind,
A gardened world mourning its once common friend.
Yet another casualty, to an earth unwound,
Wept over in silence, a garden without sound.
